title: WWII Propaganda - Rosie the Riveter Poster
content:
Hi - I'm using this poster for a school club sort of thing and am replacing the quote "We Can Do It!" Either IDing the font in the poster or suggesting something (either common or free) that would work to kind of keep the authentic look would be great!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218044805im_/http:/typophile.com/files/180px-Rosie_the_Riveter_5609.jpg)

Fullsize: [http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/6/6a/Rosie\_the\_Riveter.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218044805/http:/upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/6/6a/Rosie_the_Riveter.jpg)
author: statikuz

comments.content:
da font has a range of free fonts, ranging through 'poor' to 'interesting', via 'plagiaristic'

[http://www.dafont.com/n-o-movement.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218044805/http:/www.dafont.com/n-o-movement.font "http://www.dafont.com/n-o-movement.font")

would probably do for this one

Erbar has a certain feel of it. But there's only a digital condensed version of it available which shares the similar x-height.  
 [http://www.linotype.com/de/378/erbar-schriftfamilie.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218044805/http:/www.linotype.com/de/378/erbar-schriftfamilie.html "http://www.linotype.com/de/378/erbar-schriftfamilie.html")
brett - that's perfect thanks! poms - I like that one too, I bet I'll use it sooner or later!
